text: spotted this on thingiverse <https://github.com/carlosgs/Cyclone-PCB-Factory/wiki> pretty darn cool think this might have to be my next project. A small cnc device that is mainly purposed for etching pcb

attachments.title: CarlosGS/Cyclone-PCB-Factory
attachments.text: Cyclone-PCB-Factory - Cyclone (Circuit Cloner) is a CNC mill intended for PCB manufacturing.

text: um, we need one of these

thats what i was thinking, looked at the BOM its mostly standard stuff, fairly cheaply gotten off ebay looked like less than $300, then they supplied printable models for all the other parts to put it together. pretty sweet
still want to play with a <https://othermachine.co>

attachments.title: Home — Other Machine Co.
attachments.text: Othermill Pro: Your In-House Board House.

text: this looks pretty neat and useful. you should build it. let me know if I can help
<@U0EL0GLEL>: any idea what resolution it can mill? At $300, we could make some concessions to density.

Not sure, I would imagine it's limited by the cut tip. It uses the same motors and electronics a 3d printer does. And is based on same firmware. Says it's optimized for a 100x160mm pcb. They use a standard dremel as the cutter. And this is the bit they mentioned <http://m.ebay.com/itm/140790334068?_mwBanner=1>

attachments.title: 5x High Quality Sharp Carbide PCB Engraving CNC Bit Router 60 Deg 0.1mm

text: i hate to admit that i kinda love this
but that doesn’t mean i don’t wanna give my 11yo toast with silly pictures on it every morning
i really like the idea of trolling one’s own progeny
james keller - trolling her own progeny since 2005!
